name: Steve Murray Phone
short_description: I coded up this simple SIP engine and video phone a few years ago.  I realized how easy it is to speak SIP without a lot of classes or abstraction.  It is just plain-english SIP.  The SIP is copy-pasted from wireshark, and then just does replace of whatever characters need to be changed to make or answer a specific call.  I don't program, and pretty soon I will have thrown away all my hard drives with this code on it.  So I figured I would put my work somewhere in case someone needs a SIP video phone.  It has been used to make calls as an ActiveX plugin, but it is pretty easy to put inside a Mozilla/Chrome plugin to make browser-based calls from a web page as well.  You can drag-drop it as a control into any Windows program in Visual Studio.  Do what you want with it, but please don't bother me about it. I am not interested in SIP, VOIP, or programming.
summary: simple SIP video phone with h264, ulaw and g729
